mocharts.plot.container.Figure3D#

class mocharts.plot.container.Figure3D(chart_id: str = None, link_id: str = None, title: Title = None, grid: Grid = None, legend: Legend = None, yAxis: list = None, xAxis: list = None, zAxis: list = None, series: list = None, visualmap: PiecewiseVisualMap | ContinuousVisualMap = None, toolbox: Toolbox = None, tooltip: Tooltip = None, brush: Brush = None, dataZoom: list = None, event: Event = None, graphic: list = None, radar: dict = None, figsize: tuple = (8, 6), color: list = ['#1f77b4', '#aec7e8', '#ff7f0e', '#ffbb78', '#2ca02c', '#98df8a', '#d62728', '#ff9896', '#9467bd', '#c5b0d5', '#8c564b', '#c49c94', '#e377c2', '#f7b6d2', '#7f7f7f', '#c7c7c7', '#bcbd22', '#dbdb8d', '#17becf', '#9edae5'], silent: bool = False, meta_info: dict = {}, auto_size: bool = True, style: dict = {'overflow': 'auto'})#

Bases: Figure

3D Figure object

Parameters:

  • chart_id (str, Optional) – Chart ID, by default None

  • link_id (str, Optional) – ID to link other chart, by default None

  • title (Title, Optional) – Title of chart, by default None

  • grid (Grid, Optional) – Grid of chart, by default None

  • legend (Legend, Optional) – Legend of chart, by default None

  • yAxis (list, Optional) – List of yaxis, by default None

  • xAxis (list, Optional) – List of xaxis, by default None

  • zAxis (list, Optional) – List of zaxis, by default None

  • series (list, Optional) – List of series, by default None

  • visualmap (PiecewiseVisualMap, ContinuousVisualMap, Optional) – Visualmap of chart, by default None

  • toolbox (Toolbox, Optional) – Toolbox of chart, by default None

  • tooltip (Tooltip, Optional) – Tooltip of chart, by default None

  • brush (Brush, Optional) – Brush of chart, by default None

  • dataZoom (list, Optional) – List of Datazoom object, by default None

  • event (Event, Optional) – Event of chart, by default None

  • graphic (list, Optional) – List graphic info, by default None

  • radar (dict, Optional) – Dict of radar info, by default None

  • figsize (tuple, Optional) – Figure size of chart, by default (8, 6)

  • color (list, Optional) – Color palette of chart, by default DEFAULT_QUALITATIVE_PALETTE

  • silent (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the figure, by default False

  • meta_info (dict, Optional) – Meta info, by default {}

  • auto_size (bool, Optional) – Whether to adjust the figure element size automatically, by default True

  • style (dict, Optional) – Style css of the figure, by default {‘overflow’: ‘auto’}

render()#

Get dictionary of options for this figure

set_grid(show: bool = True, left: str = '5%', top: str = '10%', right: str = '5%', bottom: str = '5%', width: str = 'auto', height: str = 'auto', backgroundColor: str = None, alpha: float = 45.0, beta: float = 45.0, distance: float = 250.0)#

Set grid config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the grid, by default True

  • left (str, Optional) – The left border location, by default ‘5%’

  • top (str, Optional) – The top border location, by default ‘5%’

  • right (str, Optional) – The right border location, by default ‘5%’

  • bottom (str, Optional) – The bottom border location, by default ‘5%’

  • width (str, Optional) – The grid width, by default ‘auto’

  • height (str, Optional) – The grid height, by default ‘auto’

  • backgroundColor (str, Optional) – The grid background color, by default None

  • alpha (float, Optional) – View angle 1, by default 45

  • beta (float, Optional) – View angle 2, by default 45

  • distance (float, Optional) – View angle 3, by default 250

set_toolbox(show: bool = True, orient: str = 'horizontal', right: str = '1%', top: str = 'auto', tool_list: list = ['dataView', 'saveAsImage'], popup: bool = True)#

Set toolbox config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the toolbox, by default True

  • orient (str, Optional) – The layout orientation of the toolbox’s icon, by default ‘horizontal’

  • right (str, Optional) – Distance between toolbox component and the right side of the container, by default ‘1%’

  • top (str, Optional) – Distance between toolbox component and the top side of the container, by default ‘auto’

  • tool_list (list, Optional) –

    The tools included in the toolbox.

    • saveAsImage: Save as image.

    • restore: Restore configuration item.

    • dataView: Data view tool, which could display data in current chart and update the chart after being edited.

    • dataZoom: Data area zooming, which only supports rectangular coordinate by now.

    • magicType: Change plot type.

    By default [‘dataZoom’, ‘dataView’, ‘saveAsImage’]

  • popup (bool, Optional) – Whether to include popup button in toolbox, by default True

set_xaxis(show: bool = True, axis_type: str = None, axis_name: str = None, data: list | ndarray = None, fontsize: int = 12, splitNumber: int = 3, lim: list | tuple = None, boundaryGap: bool = None, axisLabel_interval: int = None, nameGap: str | int = None, axisLabel_width: int = None, splitArea_show: bool = False, axisLabel_overflow='none', axisLabel_rotate: int = None, splitLine_show: bool = True, axisTick_align: str = 'none', axis_list: list = None, ignored: bool = False)#

Set x-axis config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the axis, by default True

  • axis_type (str, Optional) – The axis type, by default None

  • axis_name (str, Optional) – The name of axis, by default None

  • data (list, Optional) – The data of axis, by default None

  • fontsize (int, Optional) – The font size of axis name, by default None

  • lim (Union[list, tuple], Optional) – The limitation range of the axis, by default None

  • boundaryGap (bool, Optional) – The boundary gap on both sides of a coordinate axis, by default None

  • nameGap (int, Optional) – Gap between axis name and axis line, by default None

  • splitNumber (int, Optional) – Number of segments of axis.

  • axisLabel_width (int, Optional) – Width of text block, by default None

  • axisLabel_overflow (str, Optional) – How to handle label out of width

  • axisLabel_interval (int, Optional) – Interval between each text label.

  • splitArea_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the splitArea, by default False

  • axisLabel_rotate (int, Optional) – The rotation degree of axis label

  • splitLine_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the splitLine, by default True

  • axisTick_align (str, Optional) – Align axis tick with label, by default ‘none’

  • axis_list (list, Optional) – The axis list input for multiple axis.

  • ignored (bool, Optional) – Whether the axis is ignored when combine axises, by default False

set_yaxis(show: bool = True, axis_type: str = None, axis_name: str = None, data: list | ndarray = None, fontsize: int = 12, lim: list | tuple = None, boundaryGap: bool = None, inverse: bool = None, splitNumber: int = 3, nameGap: str | int = None, axisLabel_width: int = None, splitArea_show: bool = False, axisLabel_overflow='none', axisLabel_interval: int = None, splitLine_show: bool = True, axisTick_align: str = 'none', axis_list: list = None, ignored: bool = False)#

Set y-axis config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the axis, by default True

  • axis_type (str, Optional) – The axis type, by default None

  • axis_name (str, Optional) – The name of axis, by default None

  • data (list, Optional) – The data of axis, by default None

  • fontsize (int, Optional) – The font size of axis name, by default None

  • lim (Union[list, tuple], Optional) – The limitation range of the axis, by default None

  • boundaryGap (bool, Optional) – The boundary gap on both sides of a coordinate axis, by default None

  • inverse (bool, Optional) – Whether to inverse y-axis, by default None

  • nameGap (int, Optional) – Gap between axis name and axis line, by default None

  • splitNumber (int, Optional) – Number of segments of axis.

  • axisLabel_width (int, Optional) – Width of text block, by default None

  • axisLabel_overflow (str, Optional) – How to handle label out of width

  • axisLabel_interval (int, Optional) – Interval between each text label.

  • splitArea_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the splitArea, by default False

  • splitLine_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the splitLine, by default True

  • axisTick_align (str, Optional) – Align axis tick with label, by default ‘none’

  • axis_list (list, Optional) – The axis list input for multiple axis.

  • ignored (bool, Optional) – Whether the axis is ignored when combine axises, by default False

set_zaxis(show: bool = True, axis_type: str = None, axis_name: str = None, data: list | ndarray = None, fontsize: int = 12, lim: list | tuple = None, boundaryGap: bool = None, splitNumber: int = 3, nameGap: str | int = None, axisLabel_width: int = None, splitArea_show: bool = False, axisLabel_overflow='none', axisLabel_rotate: int = None, splitLine_show: bool = True, axisTick_align: str = 'none', axis_list: list = None, ignored: bool = False)#

Set z axis config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the axis, by default True.

  • axis_type (str, Optional) – The axis type, by default None.

  • axis_name (str, Optional) – The name of the axis, by default None.

  • data (list, Optional) – The data of the axis, by default None.

  • fontsize (int, Optional) – The font size of the axis name, by default None.

  • lim (Union[list, tuple], Optional) – The limitation range of the axis, by default None.

  • boundaryGap (bool, Optional) – Whether there is a boundary gap on both sides of the axis, by default None.

  • nameGap (int, Optional) – Gap between axis name and axis line, by default None.

  • splitNumber (int, Optional) – Number of segments of the axis, by default None.

  • axisLabel_width (int, Optional) – Width of the text block, by default None.

  • axisLabel_overflow (str, Optional) – How to handle labels overflowing the axis width, by default None.

  • splitArea_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the split area, by default False.

  • axisLabel_rotate (int, Optional) – The rotation degree of the axis label, by default None.

  • splitLine_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the split line, by default True.

  • axisTick_align (str, Optional) – Align the axis tick with the label, by default ‘none’.

  • axis_list (list, Optional) – The axis list input for multiple axes, by default None.

  • ignored (bool, Optional) – Whether the axis is ignored when combining axes, by default False.
